name: Automated gating
description: Apply one of the OpenCyto automated gating methods to your data.

properties.name: pop
properties.description: population patterns of '+/-‘ or ’+/-+/-', which tells the algorithm which side (postive or negative) of 1d gate or which quadrant of 2d gate to be kept.

properties.name: gating_args
properties.description: Named arguments passed to gating function.

properties.name: collapseDataForGating
properties.description: When TRUE, data is collapsed (within groups if 'groupBy' specified) before gating and the gate is replicated across collapsed samples. When set FALSE (or blank), then 'groupBy' argument is only used by 'preprocessing' and ignored by gating.

properties.name: groupBy
properties.description: If given, samples are split into groups by the unique combinations of study variable. When split is numeric, then samples are grouped by every N samples.

properties.name: preprocessing_args
properties.description: Named arguments passed to the preprocessing function.
